results.title: The Echinoderms (TEFC): starfish, brittle stars, sea urchins, sea cucumbers
results.brief_description: Looks at the tide pool animals the echinoderms which share their evolutionary limbs with our own phylum. The segments introduce sea stars, brittle stars, basket stars, sea urchins, sand dollars and sea cucumbers.

results.title: The Eating feel good movie
results.brief_description: In this film, food becomes a visual delight and eating is seen as fun. The film aims to develop understanding of the body’s needs for different kinds of foods and how basic foods are used by the body. This film attempts to make children aware of the advantages of eating the correct foods.

results.title: The Earth and its movement around the sun
results.brief_description: The earth with its tilted axis travels round the sun once every year. There are four important stages on this journey which are responsible for producing our four seasons: summer, autumn, winter and spring. The film details this journey.

results.title: The Earth's movements
results.brief_description: Shows four movements of the earth. Explains rotation and revolution and indicates how these account for day and night, time differences and the seasons. Illustrates the procession of the equinoxes and the galactic rotation. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description: Shows four movements of the earth. Explains rotation and revolution and indicates how these account for day and night, time differences and the seasons. Illustrates the procession of the equinoxes and the galactic rotation. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Ears and hearing
results.brief_description: Structure and functions of the human ear and how sound waves are transmitted to the brain. Discusses hearing loss and physical malfunctioning and deterioration of the ear.

results.title: The Dynamic atmosphere
results.creator_credit: Roger Seccombe, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: This film shows how the technicians and scientists of CSIRO measures aspects of the atmosphere. This includes experiments on “rotational” effects and their relevance to climatic disturbances. It shows the influence of cloud types on solar and infra-red radiation streams, and features an explanation of the ozone layer. Narrated by Keith Livingstone.

results.title: The Dunera boys
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a group of Jewish men who after the outbreak of World War II, were rounded up in England and, in the face of there being suspicion about them, sent out to Australia on board the S.S. Dunera. In Australia they were interned in a camp at Hay, in New South Wales, a location which, with their sense of humour intact, the “boys” transformed into a parody of Vienese cafe society. Among their number were some of the most remarkable and individual characters to arrive on Australian shores and slowly but surely they broke down the barriers and established a bond of trust with the Australian authorities, a trust which eventually allowed the group to become part of the effort to defeat the threatening Fascist forces, and later, people of great distinction in post-war Australia.
results.description: Tells the story of a group of Jewish men who after the outbreak of World War II, were rounded up in England and, in the face of there being suspicion about them, sent out to Australia on board the S.S. results.title: The Dummerer
results.creator_credit: Ollie Martin and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Gothic melodrama, which makes dramatic and economical use of empty frames, overlapping sound and striking images to tell its story of a faith healer’s attempt to de-traumatise and restore the speech of a dumb young man. The results are sensational.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ollie Martin and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: The Drunkard's reformation
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: An alcoholic father takes time to reflect when he, accompanied by his child, is confronted with a stage performance preaching the evils of drinking. Cast includes Arthur V. Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Adele DeGarde, Charles Avery, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett, Harry Solter. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.creator_credit: Sue Brooks, AFTRS and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The Australian myth of Russell Drysdale’s painting “The Drover’s Wife” retold from a different perspective. Based on a short story by Murray Bail. Cast includes Elaine Gay, Jeff Ashby and Martin Vaughan. (Awards: Winner of Rouben Mamoulian Award, Sydney Film Festival 1985)
